title: Hannes Reeh 2015 Rohstoff Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: Sunny stone fruit and earth mingle on nose and palate of this user-friendly Chardonnay. The midpalate is plump with textured ripeness, red apple and yellow plum. A very fruit-forward, easy-drinking wine with lots of drive and presence.

title: La Bollina 2015 Ventola  (Gavi)
description: This opens with aromas that recall white wild flower, orchard fruit and a hint of beeswax. The medium-bodied palate offers creamy white peach, vanilla, citrus and a hint of white almond alongside bright acidity.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 Round Rock Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: While light as a feather, this exceptionally spry dry Riesling delivers invigorating citrus refreshment. Blossomy in perfume, it's exquisitely crisp and almost airy in texture. The finish lingers on a crushed mineral tone.

title: Landhaus Mayer 2015 Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: A flinty hit on the nose confirms the very freshness of this wine. The palate is dry, lithe and fresh with lemon and tender, white strawberry notes. This is light enough to while away lazy summer afternoons and evenings.

title: Klinker Brick 2013 1850 Degrees Red (Lodi)
description: Big and beautiful, this full-figured and firm-textured wine has a very dark color, warm fruit flavors like those in cherry and blackberry pie and firm tannins that give it a nice, gripping texture. It's definitely full bodied but still velvety on the tongue.

title: Tenuta di Tavignano 2015 Villa Torre  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and Spanish broom lead the nose while the juicy palate offers mature yellow peach, citrus, pineapple and a hint of almond. Bright acidity provides balance and a crisp finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Tenuta Duecorti 2010  Barolo
description: Aromas of espresso, vanilla, French oak and mature plum come together in the glass. The warm palate delivers juicy black cherry, mocha and anisette alongside fine-grained tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Colterenzio 2011 Mantsch Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Subtle aromas of wild berry, scorched earth and clove slowly emerge in the glass. On the palate, notes of allspice and cassis add depth to the black cherry core while chewy tannins provide the framework. Best through 2017.

title: Comartin 2013 Tierra Alta Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Suave blueberry-chocolate notes meet with light and delicate violet florality on the nose of this single vineyard bottling from the Bay Area-based producer. The palate is lively and tart with underripe blackberries, sesame oil and a sizzling acidity.

title: Deltetto 2015 Daivej  (Roero)
description: Jasmine, orange blossom and aromatic herb aromas lead the nose on this round, friendly white. The soft, bright palate offers yellow peach, apricot and pear while a note of white almond backs up the finish.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Famiglia Bianchi Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Briny notes of oyster shell blend with spicy barrel notes and core apple aromas on the bouquet of this crisp, pure, minerally Chardonnay. Flavors of apple, quince, orange marmalade and minerals finish sturdy and secure.

title: Château Carpe Diem 2015 Cuvée Multa Paucis Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The name of this wine translates as “seize the day,” an expression it matches with its bright acidity and full, red-berry flavors. Bone dry while fruity, it is a wine for food.

title: Château d'Ollières 2015 Prestige Rosé (Coteaux Varois)
description: This wine is pale in color, crisp and light with red-currant fruits. The acidity at the end is tangy and refreshing.

title: Château Pigoudet 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: The herbal flavors of the wild garrigue go through this pale, almost white wine. It does have a touch of tannin giving a structure, as well as a cool character from the high elevation of the vineyards. The aftertaste is refreshing.

title: Buck Shack 2012 Red (Lake County)
description: A smoky, salt-and-pepper aroma, and woody, spicy flavors add complexity to the core of concentrated, dark fruit flavors. The wine is full bodied, very well textured and grippy on the palate, all of which helps to extend the fruit notes on the finish.

title: Vionta 2014 Limited Release Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Dusty apple and minerally aromas are regionally and varietally correct. Flavors of apple and citrus are standard, while an unbroken finish is holding form. Drink now.

title: Weingut Niklas 2013 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of blackberry, violet, dark baking spice and a whiff of chopped herb. The fresh, savory palate offers plum, blackberry and clove alongside lithe tannins while zesty acidity leaves a tangy finish. Drink through 2016.

title: Achaval-Ferrer 2013 Quimera Red (Mendoza)
description: Grapy aromas of berry fruits and the dust of spearmint gum set up a loud, high-acid, seemingly electrified palate that tastes of black currant, blackberry and plum. Overall, this is a linear feeling Bordeaux blend with bracing acidity and minty oak. Time should only help it along. Drink through 2022.

title: Belisario 2015 Vigneti del Cerro  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
description: Fresh and savory, this offers aromas and flavors of fresh apple, green Anjou pear and almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish while a hint of saline signals the close.

title: Moncaro 2014 Verde Ca' Ruptae  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: Delicate aromas of yellow flower and citrus lift out of the glass while the racy, linear palate offers grapefruit, nectarine and graphite alongside zesty acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Délicat Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Red-berry fruits dominate this crisp, clear wine with its direct line of acidity and light aftertaste. It's aromatic and full of life.

title: Moshin 2012 Calliope Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine presents itself initially as having a bold, big body, yet is actually light on its feet as it opens, revealing aromas of cherry liqueur, rhubarb joined with a funk of black licorice and sassafras.

title: Rôtie Cellars 2014 Northern White (Washington)
description: This wine is all Marsanne fermented and aged in stainless steel. Aromatically reserved notes of almond, lees and candle wax lead to medium-full, well-balanced flavors that linger.

title: Ousterhout 2015 Woods Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine fermented in stainless steel, this is a bright, lively tangle of cherry and orange built around bristling acidity that practically sizzles on the palate. Light-bodied and plenty crisp, it mellows to show length and breadth on the finish.

title: Pacific Rim 2014 Solstice Vineyard Riesling (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of Bosc pear, apple, diesel and apricot lead to elegant fruit flavors. It drinks just a hair off dry. The concentration seems a bit wanting but what's there is well balanced.

title: Patterson 2013 BDX Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (46%), Cabernet Franc (24%), Merlot (22%) and Malbec. Aromas of dark fruit and spice are followed by cherry and black-fruit flavors, backed by lightly grainy tannins.

title: Ravenswood 2014 Besieged Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a nicely made blend of Petite Sirah, Carignane, Zinfandel, Syrah, Alicante Bouschet and Barbera, defined by its generosity of power and tannin as well as a concentration of blackberry, Italian deli meat and leather.

title: Roblar 2013 Sangre de Dioses Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Red currant, black cherries and a touch of dried oregano show on this blend of 60% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot, and 10% Grenache. The mouthfeel is quite full of flavor although relatively medium-bodied, with red cherry and blackberry fruit flavors cut by a pencil lead minerality. Easy to quaff and quite hedonistic.

title: Pondera 2012 Red Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Stillwater Creek and Dineen vineyard fruit, aromas of assorted dried herbs, coffee and barrel spices intermingle. The dark-fruit flavors are elegant, polished and reserved, supported by lightly grainy tannins.

title: Perla del Garda 2013 Vendemmia Tardiva  (Lugana)
description: Aromas suggesting Anjou pear, almond, grilled herb and a whiff of smoke come together in the glass while the palate offers tangerine zest, ginger and mineral. Fresh acidity lends balance.
